artifact package

Submodules

artifact.artifact module

Artifact module

This module defines abstract and concrete classes for generating different types of artifacts. The primary purpose of this module is to simulate ramping artifacts in the energy context.

Classes:

Artifact: An abstract base class for artifact generation. Saw: A class for generating sawtooth artifacts. Saw_centered: A class for generating centered sawtooth artifacts. Saw_centered_Francois: A class for generating sawtooth artifacts with specific parameters for system imbalance data.

Usage:

Instantiate a subclass of Artifact and call its generate method to produce an artifact.

Example:

saw = Saw() artifact = saw.generate()

class artifact.artifact.Artifact(max_width: float = 59)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for generating artifacts.

Attributes:

max_width (float): Maximum width of the artifact. generator (Generator): Random number generator.

abstract generate(max_width: int, min_width: int, min_rate: float, max_rate: float) → ndarray[source]

Abstract method to generate an artifact.

Parameters:

  • max_width (int) – Maximum artifact width.

  • min_width (int) – Minimum artifact width.

  • max_rate – Maximum absolute slope of the ramp.

  • min_rate – Minimum absolute slope of the ramp.

Returns:

An array with the artifact.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class artifact.artifact.Saw(max_width: float = 59)[source]

Bases: Artifact

Sawtooth artifact - Ramping artifact in the energy context.

generate(max_width: int = 59, min_width: int = 1, min_rate=0.00023, max_rate=0.387) → ndarray[source]

Generate isolated ramping artifact. If width is 1 or 2, the artifact is empty.

Parameters:

  • max_width (int) – Maximum artifact width, defaults to 59.

  • min_width (int) – Minimum artifact width, defaults to 1.

  • max_rate (float) – Maximum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.387.

  • min_rate (float) – Minimum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.00023.

Returns:

An array with the artifact.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class artifact.artifact.Saw_centered(max_width: float = 59)[source]

Bases: Artifact

Centered Sawtooth artifact.

generate(max_width: int = 59, min_width: int = 3, min_rate=0.00023, max_rate=0.387) → Tuple[Any, int][source]

Generate isolated centered ramping artifact. Point of activation is returned to place in the center of a window. No empty artifacts.

Parameters:

  • max_width (int) – Maximum artifact width, defaults to 59.

  • min_width (int) – Minimum artifact width, defaults to 3.

  • max_rate (float) – Maximum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.387.

  • min_rate (float) – Minimum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.00023.

Returns:

Tuple containing an array with the artifact and the point of activation.

Return type:

Tuple[Any, int]

class artifact.artifact.Saw_centered_Francois(max_width: float = 59)[source]

Bases: Artifact

Sawtooth artifact. Ramping artifact in system imbalance data with adapted parameters.

generate(max_width: int = 20, min_width: int = 2, min_rate=0.025, max_rate=0.45) → Tuple[Any, int][source]

Generate isolated centered ramping artifact. No empty artifacts.

Parameters:

  • max_width (int) – Maximum artifact width, defaults to 20.

  • min_width (int) – Minimum artifact width, defaults to 2.

  • max_rate (float) – Maximum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.45.

  • min_rate (float) – Minimum absolute slope of the ramp, defaults to 0.025.

Returns:

Tuple containing an array with the artifact and the point of activation.

Return type:

Tuple[Any, int]
